## R, RStudio, and R Markdown

### *Downloading*

1. Download [R](https://www.r-project.org/).
2. Download [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/).

### *Use R and RStudio Online*

* [RStudio Cloud](https://rstudio.cloud/)

### *References*

* [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html) - book by Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund
* [Getting Used to R, RStudio, and R Markdown](https://ismayc.github.io/rbasics-book/) - book by Ismay and Kennedy
* [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) - book by Wickham
* Springer's [Use R!](https://link.springer.com/bookseries/6991) series
* Software Carpentry's [R for Reproducible Scientific Analysis](http://swcarpentry.github.io/r-novice-gapminder/) tutorial
* John's Hopkins [Foundations Using R](https://www.coursera.org/specializations/data-science-foundations-r) specialization through Coursera

#### R Markdown
* [R Markdown: The Definitive Guide](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/) - book by Yihui Xie, J. J. Allaire, Garrett Grolemund
* [R Markdown Cookbook](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown-cookbook/) - book by Yihui Xie, Christophe Dervieux, Emily Riederer
* [Getting Started with R Markdown](https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials/rmarkdown/) - Tutorial
* [Pimp my RMD: a few tips for R Markdown](https://holtzy.github.io/Pimp-my-rmd/) - a list of tips I use on a regular basis


#### Creating Websites in R
* [Creating websites in R](https://www.emilyzabor.com/tutorials/rmarkdown_websites_tutorial.html)
* [blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown](https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/) - book by Yihui Xie, Amber Tomas, Alison Hill
  - [Up & running with blogdown in 2021](https://www.apreshill.com/blog/2020-12-new-year-new-blogdown/) - more up to date
* [R Markdown: Websites](https://garrettgman.github.io/rmarkdown/rmarkdown_websites.html)


#### Data Visualization

* [A ggplot2 tutorial for beautiful plotting in R](https://www.cedricscherer.com/2019/08/05/a-ggplot2-tutorial-for-beautiful-plotting-in-r/) - tutorial
* [R Graphics Cookbook](https://r-graphics.org/index.html) - book by Winston Chang

#### Cheatsheets
* [RStudio Cheatsheets](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/) - scroll to the bottom to see contributed cheatsheets
* [R Graphics for Intro Stats](https://ds4stats.github.io/uscots2017/assets/refcard/m107-EDA-refcard.pdf) - Adam Loy
* [Beautiful plotting in R: A `ggplot2` cheatsheet](http://zevross.com/blog/2014/08/04/beautiful-plotting-in-r-a-ggplot2-cheatsheet-3/) - Zev Ross

## Git and Github

### *Downloading*

1. Download [Git](https://git-scm.com/downloads)
2. Create [GitHub](https://github.com/) or [Bitbucket](https://bitbucket.org/) account to host your repositories
3. Optional: download [GitHub Desktop](https://desktop.github.com/) or [Sourcetree](https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/) GUI

### *References*
* [Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com/index.html) - book by Jenny Bryan
* Udacity's free course [Version Control with Git](https://www.udacity.com/course/version-control-with-git--ud123)
* Software Carpentry's [Version Control with Git](http://swcarpentry.github.io/git-novice/) tutorial


---

## SAS

### *Use SAS online*
* [SAS OnDemand](https://support.sas.com/en/software/ondemand-for-academics-support.html#instructors)

### *References*
* [Free SAS e-books](https://support.sas.com/en/books/free-books.html)
  - [SAS Programming for R Users](https://support.sas.com/content/dam/SAS/support/en/books/free-books/sas-programming-for-r-users.pdf) and corresponding [course](https://support.sas.com/edu/schedules.html?crs=SP4R&ctry=US)
* Recommended books for purchase:
  - [Getting Started with SAS Programming](Getting Started with SAS Programming)
  - [The Little SAS Book: A Primer](https://sasinstitute.redshelf.com/book/1830656)

## Python

### *Downloading*

* Download [Anaconda Distribution](https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/) to install Python and Jupyter Notebook

### *References*

* [IPython Cookbook](https://ipython-books.github.io/) - book by Cyrille Rossant
* [Jupyter Notebook documentation](https://jupyter.readthedocs.io/en/latest/running.html#running)
* Software Carpentry's [Programming with Python](http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/) tutorial
* Udacity's free course [Introduction to Python Programming](https://www.udacity.com/course/introduction-to-python--ud1110)
* [More links to Python resources for beginners](https://www.mapcon.com/us-en/software-engineering-python)...

## LaTeX

### *Downloading*

* Download a full [TeX distribution](https://www.latex-project.org/get/) (e.g., MacTeX for MacOS or MiKTeX for Windows)

### *Use LaTeX Online*

* [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/) - online, collaborative LaTeX editor

### *References*

* [The Not So Short Introduction to LaTeX](http://mirrors.rit.edu/CTAN/info/lshort/english/lshort.pdf) - book by Oetiker, Partl, Hyna and Schlegl
* [List of LaTeX mathematical symbols](https://oeis.org/wiki/List_of_LaTeX_mathematical_symbols)

* [Data Science in a Box](https://datasciencebox.org/index.html)

### Journal Articles

* [Infrastructure and Tools for Teaching Computing Throughout the Statistical Curriculum](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00031305.2017.1397549?journalCode=utas20) - Centinkaya-Rundel & Rundel, TAS Vol 72, 2018
